title: Anthony Joshua could vacate world title after Andy Ruiz Jr rematch
text:
Joshua aims to reclaim his titles against Ruiz Jr (Picture: Getty)

David Haye believes the winner of Andy Ruiz Jr vs Anthony Joshua will be forced to relinquish one of the heavyweight world titles.

Joshua attempts to gain revenge over Ruiz Jr in December and reclaim the WBO, WBA (Super) and IBF belts he lost to the Mexican last June.

But with mandatories set to be called for the IBF and WBO titles, Haye thinks the winner will have to give up one of his belts.

‘Usyk, that’s an ideal situation,’ Haye said on Derek Chisora’s next fight.

Haye suggested AJ will have to give up one of his belts (Picture: Getty)

‘Whoever wins that title fight [between Ruiz Jr and Joshua], whether they relinquish a belt or not, we don’t know.

‘There’s speculation it’s going to happen. If it does happen, Derek is in a good position ranking wise, particularly after his performance here and after winning that WBO strap.

‘Parker is a great fighter, but we tried to get it for tonight and he got a spider bite.

‘He’s in training, I would have loved that fight to happen.

‘If we can reschedule that for another time, Derek would love that.’

Chisora is bidding for another world title tilt in 2020 after his knockout win over David Price on Saturday night.

Haye would want Chisora to fight for the WBO title if it becomes vacant (Picture: Reuters)

The 35-year-old has enjoyed a renaissance in his heavyweight career in the last year after linking up with Haye.

Price stepped up to replace Joseph Parker against Chisora and the British fighter is hopeful he can reschedule his clash with the former WBO champion.

description: Anthony Joshua may be forced to relinquish one of his world titles if he can beat Andy Ruiz Jr in their rematch, according to David Haye.
